title: Details regarding 0-19 HCP, Supporting Families and Family Hubs

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Under the Freedom of Information Act 2000, please provide me with details regarding the 0-19 Healthy Child Programme, Supporting Families and Family Hubs at Sheffield City Council:
0-19 Healthy Child Programme
1. What is the current 0-19 Healthy Child Programme contract duration (start date and end date)?
2. What is the current 0-19 Healthy Child Programme total contract value?
3. Who is the current lead supplier and subcontractors of the 0-19 Healthy Child Programme?
4. Has a decision been made as to whether the current contract for the 0-19 Healthy Child Programme is being extended or renewed?
5. Is there an extension clause in place for the 0-19 Healthy Child Programme? If so, what is the duration of the extension and when would the first extension take effect if the clause was applied?
6. Please provide a copy of the full Invitation to Tender (ITT) published when the 0-19 Healthy Child Programme contract was last advertised.
7. Is any provision within the 0-19 Healthy Child Programme delivered online/digitally/virtually? If so, please provide details as to the nature of the provision/product on offer for families.
8. Please provide a list of the suppliers who applied and who were successful and not successful when the Healthy Child Programme contract was last commissioned.
9. Who is the commissioning officer with the council responsible for the Healthy Child Programme?
10.What are the timelines for recommissioning your 0-19 Healthy Child Programme?
Supporting Families
1.Please provide a list of the suppliers who applied and who were successful and not successful when the Supporting Families contract was last commissioned.
2.Who is the commissioning officer with the council responsible for Supporting Families?
Family Hubs
1.Who is the commissioning officer responsible for the Family Hubs contract?
2.Please provide a list of the suppliers delivering the current Family Hubs offer.
Yours faithfully,
A Greenewood

Dear A Greenewood,
Thank you for your request for information relating to 0-19 HCP,
Supporting Families and Family Hubs which we received on 31/07/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. What is the current 0-19 Healthy Child Programme contract duration
(start date and end date)?
• The contract is reviewed annually as part of NHS planning and
contracting requirements and runs in line with financial years
commencing 1^st April each year. Current contract date ends 31^st
March 2029.
2. What is the current 0-19 Healthy Child Programme total contract value?
• £7, 929, 647.65 for 1^st April 2024 – 31^st March 2025
3. Who is the current lead supplier and subcontractors of the 0-19
Healthy Child Programme?
Sheffield Children’s Foundation Trust. There are no subcontractors.
4. Has a decision been made as to whether the current contract for the
0-19 Healthy Child Programme is being extended or renewed?
• Renewed
5. Is there an extension clause in place for the 0-19 Healthy Child
Programme? If so, what is the duration of the extension and when would
the first extension take effect if the clause was applied?
• The contract is held by NHS South Yorkshire Integrated Care Board and
a review is undertaken annually as part of NHS planning and
contracting requirements through SY ICB (Sheffield Place) and
Sheffield City Council associate commissioner arrangements.
6. Please provide a copy of the full Invitation to Tender (ITT) published
when the 0-19 Healthy Child Programme contract was last advertised.
• Sheffield City Council (SCC) is an associate to the NHS contract
between NHS South Yorkshire Integrated Care Board and Sheffield
Children’s Foundation Trust. As an associate, SCC jointly commission
services due to local joint commissioning arrangements across our NHS
providers, NHS South Yorkshire Integrated Care Board awarded the
contract which the 0-19 Health Child Programme is delivered under via
Direct Award Process A under the Health Care Services (Provider
Selection Regime) Regulations 2023.
7. Is any provision within the 0-19 Healthy Child Programme delivered
online/digitally/virtually? If so, please provide details as to the
nature of the provision/product on offer for families.
• Delivery of 0-19 HCP services in Sheffield is predominately face to
face with a small amount of virtual provision where required for
specific circumstances. A flexible approach is taken to meet parental
and service need.
8. Please provide a list of the suppliers who applied and who were
successful and not successful when the Healthy Child Programme
contract was last commissioned.
• N/A
9. Who is the commissioning officer with the council responsible for the
Healthy Child Programme?
• Joe Horobin, Director of Integrated Commissioning
10. What are the timelines for recommissioning your 0-19 Healthy Child
Programme?
• Annual in line with NHS planning requirements and before 31^st March
2025.
Supporting Families
1. Please provide a list of the suppliers who applied and who were
successful and not successful when the Supporting Families contract
was last commissioned.
• The Supporting Families programme is led internally by the Integrated
Commissioning team within Sheffield City Council. The funding is used
to support the delivery of early help across the city.
2. Who is the commissioning officer with the council responsible for
Supporting Families?
• Joe Horobin, Director of Integrated Commissioning
Family Hubs
1. Who is the commissioning officer responsible for the Family Hubs
contract?
• There is no single Family Hubs Contract. The Sheffield Family Hubs are
co-ordinated by an internal directorate within the Council and core
services are delivered internally. The Family Hub & Start for Life
programme is delivered via a programme board approach. Commissioning
of family hub services is delivered by Sheffield City Council Early
Years and Early Help Commissioning Team.
2. Please provide a list of the suppliers delivering the current Family
Hubs offer.
The funding is used to deliver enhanced internal services, and we work
pro-actively with partners across the city to deliver the start for life
offer.
·       Sheffield Childrens NHS Foundation Trust
·       Sheffield Teaching Hospitals
·       Empowering Parent Empowering Communities (EPEC)  ZEST
·       Light Peer Support PNMH
·       Steel City Dads PNMH ZEST
Family Hub Network Members;
• BSF Family Hub Network members;
◦ Manor and Castle Development Trust,
◦ SOAR,
◦ Sheffield YWCA
• Community Champion Grant network members;
◦ Ellesmere Children’s Centre,
◦ Foxhill Forum Ltd, Heeley Trust,
◦ High Green Development Trust Ltd,
◦ ISRAAC Somali Community Association,
◦ Manor Castle Development Trust,
◦ Sharrow Community Forum,
◦ Sheffield Wednesday Football Club Community Programme,
◦ Ship Shape Health & Wellbeing (Community Hub) Ltd,
◦ Ship Shape Health & Wellbeing Ltd,
◦ The Terminus,
◦ Woodhouse & District Community Forum,
◦ Zest.
• Home Learning Environment (commission linked to the delivery of the
Making it REAL programme);
◦ Wincobank Nursery and Infant school,
◦ Caterpillar Childcare,
◦ Hinde House 2-16 Academy.
◦ National Children’s Charity – Making it Real training and resources
